info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 10:27PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Rutherford, northeastern Henderson, northwestern Polk and southeastern Buncombe Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 1027 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles north of Hendersonville, or 4 miles south of Fairview In Buncombe County, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fairview In Buncombe County, Lake Lure, Chimney Rock Village, Chimney Rock State Park, Bat Cave, Fletcher, Dana, Gerton and Edneyville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
